1.text: Consider how heavy and dense you want your punching bag to be.

2.text: Use clothes as the only filling if you want a lightweight punching bag.

3.text: Add sand or sawdust in addition to clothes to make your punching bag heavier.

4.text: Cut buttons, zippers, and other metal pieces off of the clothes you’ll be using.

5.text: Pour your sand or sawdust into resealable bags if you’re using any.

6.text: Wrap any sand or sawdust bags you’re using with duct tape so they don’t rip.

7.text: Weigh the filling to make sure you have enough for your bag.

8.text: Unzip the opening at the top of your punching bag.

9.text: Add the first layer of filling to the bottom of the bag.

10.text: Use a long tool, like a baseball bat, to pack the filling down.

11.text: Continue to add layers of filling, packing them down as you go.

12.text: Zip your punching bag closed once you reach the top with the filling.
